titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tom Feelings Artwork
titlestmt.author: by Tina Evans and Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:33

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of original artwork, dummies, prints and posters documenting Tom Feelings's work as an artist and book illustrator. The collection includes the original artwork for The Middle Passage: White Ships/Black Cargo, which consists of 51 drawings, currently housed in 47 frames, created in mixed-media tempera, pen and tissue, heightened with white and collage; the artwork is accompanied by 11 text panels that were part of a traveling exhibition. Other book illustration projects documented in the collection include Now Sheba Sings the Song by Maya Angelou, Soul Looks Back in Wonder, and I Saw Your Face by Kwame Senu Neville Dawes. Also found are numerous portraits of women and children, as well as drawings of a Civil War soldier, New York City, and street scenes that document Feelings's early career as an artist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Reese Company on various funds, 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tom Feelings Artwork is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tom Feelings Artwork. James Weldon Johnson Collection in the Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

As part of basic processing carried out in 2010-2011, unframed artwork was housed in acid-free folders and boxes, while framed artwork was left in the frames. Descriptive information in the inventory below is drawn primarily from information supplied with the collection in the form of the auction catalog. The information about specific artwork has not been verified. It is supplied here in order to provide some level of access to the material within the collection.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Tom Feelings (1933-2003)
bioghist.p: Tom Feelings, artist and illustrator, was best known for his book The Middle Passage: White Ships/Black Cargo (1995) which depicts life on the ships that brought slaves from Africa to America. Feelings was born in 1933, grew up in Brooklyn, and studied at the Cartoonists and Illustrators School and later at the School of Visual Arts. In addition to The Middle Passage, Feelings illustrated numerous books, including Now Sheba Sings the Song (1987) and Soul Looks Back in Wonder (1993), which were collaborations with Maya Angelou, and I Saw Your Face (2005), a collaboration with Kwame Senu Neville Dawes, which was published posthumously. He was also a professor of art at the University of South Carolina from 1989 to 1996. Feelings passed away in 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of original artwork, dummies, prints and posters documenting Tom Feelings's work as an artist and book illustrator. The collection includes the original artwork for The Middle Passage: White Ships/Black Cargo , which consists of 51 drawings, currently housed in 47 frames, created in mixed-media tempera, pen and tissue, heightened with white and collage; the artwork is accompanied by 11 text panels that were part of a traveling exhibition. Other book illustration projects documented in the collection include Now Sheba Sings the Song by Maya Angelou, Soul Looks Back in Wonder , and I Saw Your Face by Kwame Senu Neville Dawes. Also found are numerous portraits of women and children, as well as drawings of a Civil War soldier, New York City, and street scenes that document Feelings's early career as an artist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Original Artwork, 1959-2003. II. Dummies, 1987-1995. III. Prints. IV. Posters.

did.unittitle: The Middle Passage: White Ships/Black Cargo (1995)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The entire suite of original mixed-media artwork, executed from 1993-1995 and published in 1995 book. Comprising 51 pieces in 47 frames, mixed-media tempera, pen and tissue, heightened with white and collage. Also included are 10 framed text panels and 1 unframed text panel that were part of the traveling exhibition.
Individual artwork is untitled. The sequential numbers reflect the order in which the artwork appears in the published book.

did.unittitle: Untitled alternative drawing for The Middle Passage [framed]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two ink, graphite, charcoal tissue, mixed media drawings. Depicts a sailing ship headed towards the continent of Africa. Featured in the touring exhibition of The Middle Passage.

did.unittitle: Alternate drawings for The Middle Passage [framed]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pair of pen-and-ink, tempera and mixed-media drawings depicting enslaved Africans and sailors. Two drawings framed together. Drawings in the style of The Middle Passage.

did.unittitle: Alternate drawings for The Middle Passage [framed]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three pen-and-ink, tempera and mixed-media drawings depicting enslaved Africans and sailors. Three drawings framed together. Drawings in the style of The Middle Passage.

did.unittitle: Alternate drawings for The Middle Passage [framed]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Captive Africans Being Rowed out to Slave Ship and Under the Ocean. Pen, ink, tempera, tissue, white and gray pencils. Two drawnings framed together. Both signed.

did.unittitle: Proposed sequel to The Middle Passage [framed]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One collage depicting a large central tree and figure, signed.

did.unittitle: Proposed sequel to The Middle Passage

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One pencil drawing depicting a large central tree and figure, matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A selection of drawings published in I Saw Your Face. Comprising: 27 original drawings, many worked into with color, some in brown-toned colored pencil. Includes the original illustration of a young woman used on the dust-jacket and cover, many portraits of young people, and some vignettes of buildings…All matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The original artwork for the published book. Comprising: 15 mixed-media pieces consisting of original watercolor, charcoal, pen, ink and wash figural drawings over painted cut-paper collage…

did.unittitle: Unpublished artwork from Soul Looks Back in Wonder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mixed media collage depicting a young man holding a book flanked by two landscapes. Matted. Collage using motifs seen in Soul Looks Back in Wonder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original sepia toned drawing with wash depicting an African-American Civil War soldier. Signed "Tom Feelings 1959."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pen and ink, egg tempera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pencil, wash and mixed media on paper. Signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Charcoal portrait of a woman in profile. Signed. Published in Now Sheba Sings the Song.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed pencil drawing. Published in Now Sheba Sings the Song.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed pencil drawing. Published in Now Sheba Sings the Song.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pen, ink, and sepia pencil portrait of woman. Signed. Published in Now Sheba Sings The Song.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Colored pencils and paint depicting a woman in profile.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of eight drawings depicting New York City and New Yorkers, all drawn in the late 1950s. New York: 1958-1960. 8 ink, pencil, and whitewash drawings…All matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of seven watercolors from early in Feelings's education as an artist. Watercolors on paper depicting street scenes with figures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of six original pencil, colored pencil, or charcoal drawings each in color or heightened with color, a few signed…Drawings are all portraits. All matted. One published in Now Sheba Sings the Song.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of eleven large original pencil and brown colored pencil and charcoal drawings, a few signed…Drawings are all portraits. All matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of six large pencil portraits depicting young children. Some signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of five large drawings depicting children in pencil or charcoal, a few signed. Drawings are all portraits. All matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of four portraits in pencil depicting younger women…Some signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of four portraits of adult women in pencil or charcoal, many signed…Drawings are all portraits. One slightly dampstained. All matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A group of six drawings in colored pencils and pen depicting women, some signed, all matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four pencil drawings depicting seated women. Some signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of six head studies in pen…Some signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of five head studies in pencil. Some signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original pencil drawings, many signed. Drawings are all portraits. All matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oil on board. Signed and dated from Ghana, 1965. Matted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laminated large charcoal self-portrait executed in Ghana, West Africa, in 1965. Portions torn away. Signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes three fully assembled sketch books with affixed printed images from The Middle Passage, and group of four maquettes, two with color covers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hand-colored half-tone print. Signed and numbered 2/40.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed lithograph…Artist's proof.

did.unittitle: Group of prints, including three artist's proofs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group of seven printed including four labeled artist's proofs…Includes Blood Knot and Four Mothers. Some signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One copy is signed to Flo Kennedy.
